mdufa 0.4.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Plot Decision Rate (Stacked Bar with Overlaid Points)

    plot_decision_rate.Rd

    Creates a stacked bar visualization of decision rates (SE/NSE/Withdrawn) with optional points and labels overlaid on the "cleared" (SE) bars.

    plot_decision_rate(
  data,
  data_se = NULL,
  cohort_status = NULL,
  fade_open_cohorts = TRUE,
  show_phe = TRUE,
  phe_label_y = 1.02,
  show_labels = TRUE,
  show_points = TRUE,
  fill_colors = c(`Withdrawn or Deleted (Not Cleared)` = "darkgray", `NSE (Not Cleared)`
    = "darkred", `SE (Cleared)` = "cornflowerblue"),
  facet_ncol = 4L,
  title = NULL,
  subtitle = NULL,
  caption = NULL
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame containing decision rate metrics with columns: fy, org, percent (0-1 scale), decision (factor with levels for stacking order).

    data_se

    A data frame containing just the SE (cleared) data for overlaying points and labels. Should have: fy, org, percent, and optionally status and percent_closed for cohort status styling.

    cohort_status

    Optional data frame with cohort status for fading bars. Should have: fy, org, percent_closed, status. If NULL and data_se contains these columns, they will be used.

    fade_open_cohorts

    Logical, whether to reduce opacity for open cohorts (default: TRUE). Requires cohort status data.

    show_phe

    Logical, whether to show COVID-19 Public Health Emergency highlighting (default: TRUE).

    phe_label_y

    Numeric, y-axis position for the PHE label (default: 1.02).

    show_labels

    Logical, whether to show percentage labels on SE bars (default: TRUE).

    show_points

    Logical, whether to show points on SE bars (default: TRUE).

    fill_colors

    Named vector of colors for decision categories. Default uses cornflowerblue for SE, darkred for NSE, darkgray for Withdrawn.

    facet_ncol

    Number of columns in facet grid (default: 4).

    title

    Optional plot title. If NULL, a default title is generated.

    subtitle

    Optional plot subtitle. If NULL, a default subtitle is used.

    caption

    Plot caption. If NULL (default), auto-generates a caption listing source reports with cutoff dates using source_caption_with_dates. If FALSE or NA, no caption is shown. If a character string, uses that value.

    Value

    A ggplot2 object that can be further customized with +.

    Details

    The plot displays decision rates using:

    • Stacked bars showing the proportion of each decision type

    • Points on the SE (cleared) bars indicating cohort status

    • Text labels showing the SE percentage

    The decision column should be a factor with levels in the desired stacking order (bottom to top). Typically:

    • "SE (Cleared)" at the bottom

    • "NSE (Not Cleared)" in the middle

    • "Withdrawn or Deleted (Not Cleared)" at the top

    The function uses fct_rev() internally to reverse the legend order so it matches the visual stacking order.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Prepare decision data
data_decision <- data |>
  mutate(
    decision = case_when(
      str_detect(metric, "SE") ~ "SE (Cleared)",
      str_detect(metric, "NSE") ~ "NSE (Not Cleared)",
      TRUE ~ "Withdrawn or Deleted (Not Cleared)"
    ) |> as_factor() |> fct_rev()
  ) |>
  group_by(fy, org) |>
  mutate(percent = value / sum(value))

# Extract SE data with cohort status
data_se <- data_decision |>
  filter(str_detect(decision, "^SE")) |>
  left_join(cohort_status, by = c("fy", "org"))

# Create plot
plot_decision_rate(
  data_decision,
  data_se = data_se,
  title = "510(k) Decision Rates"
)
} # }
